meanings.sent1: I need five sen to buy a snack.
meanings.sent2: In Japan, you can use sen to pay for small items.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sen go to school? To learn how to multiply!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a handful of sen, spreading warmth wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The sen jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his trip to Tokyo.

meanings.definition: A suffix used to form ordinal numbers.
meanings.sent1: She was in her teens, celebrating her sixteenth birthday.
meanings.sent2: First, second, third, and so on are examples of using sen in numbers.
meanings.sent3: Why did the number eight break up with the number nine? Because nine was too sen-sitive!
meanings.sent4: The days passed by in a blur, each one feeling more sen-like than the last.
meanings.sent5: The sen at the end of the number made it sound more official.

meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of Ireland.
meanings.sent1: Back in the day, people used sen to buy groceries in Ireland.
meanings.sent2: The sen was replaced by the euro as Ireland's currency.
meanings.sent3: Why did the leprechaun carry a pot of sen? To have some spare change!
meanings.sent4: The memories of using sen in Ireland felt like a distant dream.
meanings.sent5: The old coins with the sen symbol were now collector's items.
